definition: to order goods/to place an order
to agree/to conclude/to draw up/to subscribe to (a newspaper etc)/to order

sentences.english: You must fill out this order form.
sentences.chinese: 這個訂貨單你要填一下。

sentences.english: Your order can go out on Monday.
sentences.chinese: 你們的訂貨在星期一就可以出貨。

sentences.english: We'll send you our completed order form tomorrow.
sentences.chinese: 明天我們會寄給你訂貨單。

sentences.english: Reducing order lead time can be taken by reducing batch.
sentences.chinese: 可以通過訂貨小批量化縮短訂貨提前期。

sentences.english: Reducing order lead time can be taken by reducing batch.
sentences.chinese: 可以通過訂貨小批量化縮短訂貨提前期。

sentences.english: I whish I could, but the people's tastes for garments change so fast.
sentences.chinese: 我希望早點訂貨，但人們對服裝的喜好變化太快。

sentences.english: The new alliance tobacco online ordering is something new.
sentences.chinese: 新商盟菸草網上訂貨是個新東西。

sentences.english: A small order this year is way too welcome.
sentences.chinese: 小批訂貨今年也受接待。

sentences.english: If you want to take an order , you must draw a check.
sentences.chinese: 如果你想訂貨，你必須開支票給你方作訂金。

sentences.english: Our purchase confirmation will be sent to you very soon.
sentences.chinese: 我方訂貨確認書不日將寄達你處。

sentences.english: But if your order is large , we will take it consideration .
sentences.chinese: 但是如果你的訂貨量很大，我們會考慮的。

sentences.english: If your term were favorable, you may expect a large order from us.
sentences.chinese: 如貴方條件優惠，則可望得到我們的大量訂貨。

sentences.english: I didn't expect to install order in autumn and winter of this year so much stress.
sentences.chinese: 沒想到今年秋冬裝訂貨壓力這麼大。

sentences.english: We received our order No. CL 818 yesterday.
sentences.chinese: 我方收到了標號爲CL818的那批訂貨。

sentences.english: We have to order from them first.
sentences.chinese: 我們必須先從他們那訂貨。

sentences.english: Because your order is too small, we have to increase our price by 5%.
sentences.chinese: 因爲貴公訂貨太少，我們只好漲價5%。

definition: to become invalid/to cancel/to delete/to nullify
to accept delivery of goods/to pick up goods
to raise or lower the price/price adjustment
responsible for its profit and losses (of organization)/financially autonomous/personal financial responsibility
